verses.verse: By the rivers<WH5104> of Babylon<WH894>, there we sat down<WH3427>, yea, we wept<WH1058>, when we remembered<WH2142> Zion<WH6726>.
We hanged<WH8518> our harps<WH3658> upon the willows<WH6155> in the midst<WH8432> thereof.

For there they that carried us away captive<WH7617> required<WH7592> of us a song<WH1697> <WH7892>; and they that wasted<WH8437> us required of us mirth<WH8057>, saying, Sing<WH7891> us one of the songs<WH7892> of Zion<WH6726>. a song: Heb. the words of a song wasted: Heb. laid us on heaps
How shall we sing<WH7891> the LORD'S<WH3068> song<WH7892> in a strange<WH5236> land<WH127>? strange: Heb. land of a stranger?
If I forget<WH7911> thee, O Jerusalem<WH3389>, let my right hand<WH3225> forget<WH7911> her cunning.

If I do not remember<WH2142> thee, let my tongue<WH3956> cleave<WH1692> to the roof of my mouth<WH2441>; if I prefer<WH5927> not Jerusalem<WH3389> above my chief<WH7218> joy<WH8057>. my chief: Heb. the head of my joy

Remember<WH2142>, O LORD<WH3068>, the children<WH1121> of Edom<WH123> in the day<WH3117> of Jerusalem<WH3389>; who said<WH559>, Rase<WH6168> it, rase<WH6168> it, even to the foundation<WH3247> thereof. Rase it: Heb. Make bare

O daughter<WH1323> of Babylon<WH894>, who art to be destroyed<WH7703>; happy<WH835> shall he be, that rewardeth<WH7999> thee as thou hast served<WH1580> <WH1576> us. destroyed: Heb. wasted rewardeth: Heb. recompenseth unto thee thy deed which thou didst to us
Happy<WH835> shall he be, that taketh<WH270> and dasheth<WH5310> thy little ones<WH5768> against the stones<WH5553>. the stones: Heb. the rock
